page.title: 02Rhyl: (continued)
page.content: Moving west from Rhyl there are a few less well known resorts on the{coast.} Near Llandudno lies the{historic} feature called The Great Orme famous for its nesting sea-birds.Inland from this point is the largest Welsh National Park,{Snowdonia.}The highest peak being Snowdon (1085m) which is visited frequently by tourists from Rhyl. The town of Rhyl thrives on{tourism} and in the winter is left like a deserted battlefield, leaving the local council to clear up and prepare for the next season.
